holidays.name: National Handwriting Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the personal touch and art of handwriting in an increasingly digital world. People are encouraged to put pen to paper and appreciate their unique script.
holidays.origin: Established in 1977 by the Writing Instrument Manufacturers Association to promote the use of pens and pencils.

holidays.name: Measure Your Feet Day
holidays.description: An odd but useful day dedicated to encouraging people to actually measure their feet to ensure proper shoe sizing, preventing blisters and discomfort.
holidays.origin: Unofficial observance that surfaced online as a quirky reminder to check shoe sizes, especially after holiday shopping.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that many adults wear improper shoe sizes; this day helps people avoid common foot problems!
